message_1: Suppose there are 5 stones arranged in a line. Players A and B alternate turns, where on each turn a player may remove either one stone or two adjacent stones. The player who removes the last stone wins the game. If player A goes first, who has a winning strategy and what is it?
message_2:
Player A has a winning strategy.

Here's the strategy for player A:

1. On the first turn, player A removes the middle stone (the 3rd stone). Now there are two separate groups of stones: one group with two stones on the left (1st and 2nd stones) and another group with two stones on the right (4th and 5th stones).

2. From this point on, player A mirrors player B's moves in the opposite group of stones. For example, if player B removes one stone from the left group, player A removes one stone from the right group. If player B removes two stones from the left group, player A removes two stones from the right group.

By following this strategy, player A ensures that they will always remove the last stone and win the game.
